title: Hamptons-Style Decor, How To Achieve That Coastal Luxury
description: Hamptons-style decor is all about refined coastal living with a sophisticated, breezy feel, just as it would feel living in The Hamptons themselves. It’s more than just a beach house aesthetic, it’s an elevated approach to relaxed elegance. Achieving this look requires attention to architectural details, curated decor, and a seamless blend of casual and […] You're reading Hamptons-Style Decor, How To Achieve That Coastal Luxury, originally posted on Decoist. If you enjoyed this post, be sure to follow Decoist on Twitter, Facebook and Pinterest.
author: Daniel Mitchell
excerpt: Hamptons-style decor is all about refined coastal living with a sophisticated, breezy feel, just as it would feel living in The Hamptons themselves. It’s
text: Hamptons-style decor is all about refined coastal living with a sophisticated, breezy feel, just as it would feel living in The Hamptons themselves. It’s more than just a beach house aesthetic, it’s an elevated approach to relaxed elegance. Achieving this look requires attention to architectural details, curated decor, and a seamless blend of casual and formal elements. Whether you’re in a coastal home or just want to channel that fresh, polished feel, here’s how to bring true Hamptons style into your space. 1. Emphasize Architectural Details True Hamptons homes are defined by their structural elements. Incorporate wainscoting, coffered ceilings, and decorative moldings to add intricacies and character to your space. Wide plank oak floors in a light or weathered finish are a must for that breezy, lived-in feel. These details create a sense of timeless elegance that sets the foundation for the entire look. Photo Credit: Envato Elements / pro_creator 2. White and Blue Color Schemes The signature Hamptons color palette revolves around crisp whites, soft creams, and classic navy blues. Layering these shades gives a fresh, sophisticated feel reminiscent of the ocean and sky. Use navy as an accent in upholstery, artwork, or decor to add contrast without overpowering the space. Photo Credit: Envato Elements / photocreo 3. Use Nautical Touches Instead of overt beach-themed decor, opt for more subtle, classy nods to the coastal lifestyle. Striped upholstery, antique ship lanterns, and woven baskets bring in a maritime feel without looking kitschy. Shells, coral, and driftwood can be incorporated sparingly through natural, organic displays. Photo Credit: Envato Elements / FollowTheFlowStudio 4. Focus on Natural Light Hamptons homes are designed to embrace natural light. Opt for large windows, French doors, and skylights whenever possible. Dress windows with airy white curtains or shutters to maintain brightness. Mirrors strategically placed opposite windows will amplify natural light and create an open, expansive feel. Photo Credit: Envato Elements / Jpavaliuk 5. Extend to Outdoor Living Spaces A true Hamptons home extends its design outdoors. Wide, inviting verandas with white Adirondack chairs, striped cushions, and wicker accents create a seamless flow between inside and out. A weathered wood dining table with lanterns overhead completes the look, perfect for alfresco entertaining. Photo Credit: Envato Elements / avanti_photo 6. Make the Kitchen the Heart of the Home The kitchen is the centerpiece of any Hamptons-style home. Opt for shaker-style cabinetry in white or soft gray, complemented by marble or quartz countertops. A large farmhouse sink, brass or nickel hardware, and glass pendant lighting create a clean yet inviting space. Open shelving with neatly arranged ceramics and glassware adds a curated touch. Photo Credit: Envato Elements / staRRush Hamptons-style decor is a perfect balance of coastal ease and refined elegance. By focusing on architectural elements, timeless furniture, and a neutral yet polished color palette, you can capture the charm and sophistication of this classic aesthetic. It’s about blending luxury with laid-back comfort. Whether you live by the sea or miles away, these thoughtful design choices will bring the essence of Hamptons living into your space. Dan is a writer with many years' experience under his belt, covering everything from entertainment news to astrology. He's now following his creativity and writing interior design content for everyone looking to brighten their space. html:
Hamptons-style decor is all about refined coastal living with a sophisticated, breezy feel, just as it would feel living in The Hamptons themselves. It’s more than just a beach house aesthetic, it’s an elevated approach to relaxed elegance. Achieving this look requires attention to architectural details, curated decor, and a seamless blend of casual and formal elements. Whether you’re in a coastal home or just want to channel that fresh, polished feel, here’s how to bring true Hamptons style into your space.

1. Emphasize Architectural Details

True Hamptons homes are defined by their structural elements. Incorporate wainscoting, coffered ceilings, and decorative moldings to add intricacies and character to your space. Wide plank oak floors in a light or weathered finish are a must for that breezy, lived-in feel. These details create a sense of timeless elegance that sets the foundation for the entire look.

2. White and Blue Color Schemes

The signature Hamptons color palette revolves around crisp whites, soft creams, and classic navy blues. Layering these shades gives a fresh, sophisticated feel reminiscent of the ocean and sky. Use navy as an accent in upholstery, artwork, or decor to add contrast without overpowering the space.

3. Use Nautical Touches

Instead of overt beach-themed decor, opt for more subtle, classy nods to the coastal lifestyle. Striped upholstery, antique ship lanterns, and woven baskets bring in a maritime feel without looking kitschy. Shells, coral, and driftwood can be incorporated sparingly through natural, organic displays.

4. Focus on Natural Light

Hamptons homes are designed to embrace natural light. Opt for large windows, French doors, and skylights whenever possible. Dress windows with airy white curtains or shutters to maintain brightness. Mirrors strategically placed opposite windows will amplify natural light and create an open, expansive feel.

5. Extend to Outdoor Living Spaces

A true Hamptons home extends its design outdoors. Wide, inviting verandas with white Adirondack chairs, striped cushions, and wicker accents create a seamless flow between inside and out. A weathered wood dining table with lanterns overhead completes the look, perfect for alfresco entertaining.

6. Make the Kitchen the Heart of the Home

The kitchen is the centerpiece of any Hamptons-style home. Opt for shaker-style cabinetry in white or soft gray, complemented by marble or quartz countertops. A large farmhouse sink, brass or nickel hardware, and glass pendant lighting create a clean yet inviting space. Open shelving with neatly arranged ceramics and glassware adds a curated touch.

Hamptons-style decor is a perfect balance of coastal ease and refined elegance. By focusing on architectural elements, timeless furniture, and a neutral yet polished color palette, you can capture the charm and sophistication of this classic aesthetic. It’s about blending luxury with laid-back comfort. Whether you live by the sea or miles away, these thoughtful design choices will bring the essence of Hamptons living into your space.

Dan is a writer with many years' experience under his belt, covering everything from entertainment news to astrology. He's now following his creativity and writing interior design content for everyone looking to brighten their space. Outside of writing, Dan enjoys embroidery, birdwatching, playing video games, all things horror, coffee, and his[...]
